DataElement.preferredName: New Tumor Event Melanoma Related Tumor Event Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of tumor event related to a newly discovered melanoma tumor.

ValueDomain.preferredName: New Melanoma Related Tumor Event Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A directive to specify the type of new melanoma related tumor event._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The spread of a malignant neoplasm to the lymph nodes.

Concepts.longName: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Lymph Nodes
Concepts.definition: The spread of a malignant neoplasm from its original site of growth to lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/24/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors.

Concepts.definition: A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission at the site of the original tumor or adjacent to it.

Concepts.definition: The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission at the site of the original tumor or adjacent to it.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating the development of a tumor in a patient with a history of a previously diagnosed tumor with a different histopathologic profile in another anatomic site as compared to the most recent one.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating the development of a tumor in a patient with a history of a previously diagnosed tumor with a different histopathologic profile in another anatomic site as compared to the most recent one.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
